content: विकारः {@--1@} Change of form or nature, transformation, deviation from the natural state; <ab>cf.</ab> विकृति. {@--2@} A change, alteration, a modification; <ls>Pt. 1. 44</ls>; <ls>Ś. 7.</ls> {@--3@} Sickness, disease, malady; विकारं खलु परमार्थतोऽज्ञात्वाऽनारंभः प्रतीकारस्य <ls>Ś. 4</ls>; <ls>Ku. 2. 48.</ls> {@--4@} Change of mind or purpose; मूर्छंत्यमी विकाराः प्रायेणैश्वर्यमत्तेषु <ls>Ś. 5. 18.</ls> {@--5@} A feeling, an emotion; विकारश्चैतन्यं भ्रमयति च संमीलयति च <ls>U. 1. 35</ls>, <ls n="U.">3. 25</ls>, <ls n="U. 3.">36</ls>; <ls>Māl. 1. 30.</ls> {@--6@} Agitation, excitement, perturbation; <ls>Ki. 17. 23.</ls> {@--7@} Contortion, contraction (as of the features of the face); प्रमथमुखबिकारैर्हासयामास गूढं <ls>Ku. 7. 95.</ls> {@--8@} (In Sān, <ab>phil.</ab>) That which is evolved from a previous source or Prakṛti. {@--9@} A wound.
